intro: Verbascum libanoticum, commonly known as the Lebanese mullein, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves that are soft to the touch. The plant produces showy yellow to orange flowers in the summer months, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to gardens. Verbascum libanoticum is also valued for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat respiratory ailments.
